article.headline: Quinnipiac 88, Robert Morris 85
article.story: MOON TOWNSHIP, Pa. (AP) -- With two seconds left on the clock, Craig Benson buried a 3-pointer and sealed a Quinnipiac win against Robert Morris, 88-85. Quinnipiac (4-2) rallied from a 12-point deficit to win. Robert Morris was ahead 71-59 with just under nine minutes to play. Then the Bobcats went on a 9-0 run, with Rob Monroe scoring six and Benson three. With the lead fluctuating, Monroe hit a 3-pointer to even the game at 82-82 with 2:43 left. Benson hit another. Chaz McCrommon brought the Colonials within one with a jumper, then Joseph Ison hit a free throw to tie it again. Benson, who scored a career-high 27 points, hit the winning shot. Monroe led scoring for Quinnipiac with 32 points. For Robert Morris (2-4), Maurice Carter had 30 points and eight rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
